My son started cussing after he was put into a class in 2nd grade for kids with behavioral issues.
He started cussing like crazy imitating the other kids. We had multiple talks with him about how to follow social rules, and social rules don't allow cussing. He asked why the kids in the class are allowed to cuss, and we said they aren't following the social rules. He stopped cussing after awhile, and we pulled him out of that class. So I don't know if it was just removing him from the situation or explaining social rules helped but it's something to try.

WRITING.TITLE: A guy walks into a bakery
WRITING.TEXT:
The baker says, "Hello. What can I get you?"
"Yes, I'd like a p-p-p-p cobbler," the guy says while wringing his hands.
The baker looks at him confused, "I'm sorry, what type of cobbler?"
"A p-p-p-p cobbler," the guy says while starting to sweat.
The baker says, "Do you mean a peach cobbler?"
The guy smiles and nods his head, "Yes, that's what I meant. Sorry, I have peach impediment."

There are a lot of Latinos like myself that either worked hard themselves or had previous generations that followed immigration laws. My great grandfather worked for over 10 years to ensure that he legally immigrated from Mexico to become a US citizen. He respected the laws. I view illegal immigrants as lazy freeloaders that think they can disrespect everyone that has worked so hard for citizenship.

My wife is part Native Alaskan, and it is shameful how dependent the native population is on the government. They really could be more self sustaining, especially in the rural villages but they are actively encouraged to wait for the government to help. She lived in a small village called Beaver and she said it was horrible living conditions. Nobody works and just waits for the government shipments to come to town.
